actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that surviving divorced wives, as well as widows, may marry after attaining age 60 without affecting their entitlement to widow's insurance benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to declare that surviving divorced wives, as well as widows, may marry after attaining age 60 without affecting their entitlement to widow's insurance benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that surviving divorced wives, as well as widows, may marry after attaining age 60 without affecting their entitlement to widow's insurance benefits.
